## Scraping

-   Scraped data from Moovit. But bus stop locations unavailable
![](Areas/SMI/SA/security-through-mobility/assets/moovit_scraped.png)

- Scraping from KGIS portal

```{python scrape from KGIS}
import xmltojson
import json
import requests
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup as bs
import pandas as pd

linksList = []
# Sample URL to fetch the html page
url = "https://stg3.ksrsac.in/kgis/rest/services/TRANSPORT/BMTC/MapServer/0/query?where=OBJECTID%3E"

params = "&text=&objectIds=%5B3000%2C+4000%5D&time=&geometry=&geometryType=esriGeometryPoint&inSR=&spatialRel=esriSpatialRelContains&relationParam=&outFields=*&returnGeometry=true&returnTrueCurves=false&maxAllowableOffset=&geometryPrecision=&outSR=4326&returnIdsOnly=false&returnCountOnly=false&orderByFields=&groupByFieldsForStatistics=&outStatistics=&returnZ=false&returnM=false&gdbVersion=&returnDistinctValues=false&resultOffset=&resultRecordCount=9000&f=geojson"

count = 0
# Get the page through get() method


for count in range (0, 10000):
    linkContent = requests.get(url + str(count) + params).content

    linkContent = json.loads(linkContent)

    with open("busstops.geojson", "w") as file:
        json.dump(linkContent, file)
    file.close()

    count = count + 1000
```
